removals.reasoning: Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant; keep the cast but remove the extra grouping.
A is already a uint8_t*; both casts and the extra grouping are unnecessary — free(A) is equivalent and clearer.
u1 already has the correct pointer type; the casts and extra parentheses are redundant.
v1 is already a uint8_t*; the casts and redundant grouping can be removed.
u2 is already a uint8_t*; remove unnecessary casts/parentheses.
v2 is already a uint8_t*; the nested casts and grouping are redundant.
w is already a uint8_t*; remove the unnecessary casts and extra parentheses.
x is already a uint8_t*; the double cast and grouping are unnecessary.
y already has the correct type; remove redundant casts/parentheses.
z is already a uint8_t*; remove the redundant casts and grouping for clarity.
The outer grouping around the cast is redundant; keep the cast but remove the extra parentheses around the whole expression. Also parentheses around the address operand are unnecessary.
Same as above: outer grouping and inner operand parentheses are unnecessary; (uint8_t*)&grid is clearer.
Remove redundant outer parentheses; keep cast with &operand without extra grouping.
Outer grouping and operand parentheses are redundant; (uint8_t*)&block is equivalent and clearer.
Remove redundant grouping around the cast; parentheses around the address operand are unnecessary.
Same simplification as prior memcpy arguments: avoid superfluous grouping.
Outer grouping is redundant; keep cast but remove extra parentheses for readability.
Parentheses around the &operand and the overall grouping are unnecessary.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses around the cast; the cast plus &operand is sufficient.
Same as above: unnecessary grouping around the cast and address-of operand.
Outer grouping is redundant; (uint8_t*)&block_tmp8_coerce is clearer and equivalent.
Remove unnecessary parentheses around the address operand and overall expression.
Redundant outer parentheses can be removed while keeping the cast.
Avoid extra grouping around the cast; the shorter form is equivalent.
Remove superfluous parentheses around the casted address.
Parentheses around the &operand and overall grouping are unnecessary.
Outer parentheses are redundant; keep cast and address-of without extra grouping.
Same simplification for clarity and concision.
Remove redundant outer grouping around the cast.
Parentheses around the &operand and the whole expression are unnecessary.
Parentheses around the single variable operand of the cast are unnecessary; (double)i is the conventional form.
The outermost grouping around the entire RHS is redundant; keep the cast and necessary parentheses around (i + 1).
Remove the redundant outer parentheses; preserve the cast and grouping that affect evaluation.
Same as above: outer grouping unnecessary, inner grouping must remain for correct order.
Remove only the redundant outer parentheses and keep those that preserve intended integer division prior to casting.
Outer parentheses are redundant; keep the essential grouping for the cast and division.
Index-expression grouping parentheses are not required; A[i * n + j] is clearer and equivalent.
Remove redundant outer grouping and unnecessary parentheses around single-variable casts; multiplication/division precedence preserves intended semantics.
Outer grouping around the numerator is larger than necessary; keep parentheses around the numerator as a whole but remove the extra grouping and simplify the expression while preserving order.
Index parentheses are redundant on the left-hand side; A[i * n + j] is equivalent and more idiomatic.
Also redundant on the right-hand side; remove the unnecessary grouping for consistency and readability.
Product groupings are not needed because * has higher precedence than +; remove redundant parentheses to simplify the expression.
Products associate left-to-right with the same precedence, so nested parentheses are unnecessary; also simplify the array indexing.
Index-expression parentheses are redundant; A[j * n + i] is clearer.
Outer parentheses around a simple addition assigned to x[i] are unnecessary and can be removed without changing precedence.
Remove redundant nested parentheses; multiplication order is preserved and the indexing can be simplified.
Index grouping parentheses are unnecessary; use the clearer form.
Parentheses around a single variable passed as a function argument are redundant; omit them for clarity.
Same as above: parentheses around the single variable argument are unnecessary and can be removed.
